amicablenumbersproject.Model

Class AmicableNumbers

  • java.lang.Object
    • amicablenumbersproject.Model.AmicableNumbers

  • public class AmicableNumbers
extends java.lang.Object
    Class represents 2 numbers. It contains 2 fields (numbers that are being checked - they are amicabe or not). Its methods are responsible for checking if numbers are amicable and returning them.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Katarzyna Filus

      • areAmicable

        public boolean areAmicable()
        Function checks if numbers are amicable. Definition from Wikipedia: Amicable numbers are two different numbers so related that the sum of the proper divisors of each is equal to the other number. To implement this function I've chosen to use 2 lists. First, I generate lists that contain numbers from 1 to number1/number2 - these are potential divisors. Next, I have to filter the numbers. It is possible thanks to filter method which takes lambda expression as an argument. The lambda exp. means that the element of the list (which is currently being filtered) is a divisor of number1 (List dividers1)/ number2 (List dividers2). At the end elements of the lists are summed and compared.
        Returns:
        true if amicable and false if not

      • areNumbersAmicable

        public boolean areNumbersAmicable()
                           throws WrongParametersException
        Function uses function areAmicable to chceck if numbers are amicable. It throws the (our own) exception when at least one of the numbers are too small.
        Returns:
        true if amicable and false if not
        Throws:
        WrongParametersException - numbers must be grater than 0.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Function that converts object of the class to String.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        amicable numbers as a String, format: first_number second_number
